terms.definition: Official records and documents that demonstrate an organization's adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and legal obligations.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or files over time, allowing users to access previous versions and see revision history.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to documents or systems, providing accountability and traceability for compliance purposes.
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing easy access and organization across an organization.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally.
A software platform that stores, organizes, tracks, and controls electronic documents and their various versions throughout their lifecycle.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously, seeing changes and updates instantly as they occur.
Software functionality that automatically tracks regulatory changes and alerts users when documentation needs to be updated to maintain compliance.
Federal Aviation Administration - the U.S. government agency responsible for regulating and overseeing all aspects of civil aviation.
European Union Aviation Safety Agency - the European regulatory body responsible for civil aviation safety in the European Union.
International Traffic in Arms Regulations - U.S. regulations that control the export and import of defense-related articles and services.
The process of organizing and classifying documents into specific groups or categories to improve searchability and organization.
The state of meeting all applicable laws, regulations, and standards required by governing bodies in a specific industry.
Systematic processes and procedures designed to ensure that products, services, or documentation meet specified requirements and standards.
The complete process a document goes through from creation to disposal, including drafting, review, approval, publication, maintenance, and archival.
